snippet: The existence of laws imprisoning gays “may constitute an act of persecution per se” if they are routinely enforced, said the ruling by the European Court of Justice.
abstract: European Court of Justice rules that refugees facing imprisonment in their home country because they are gay may have grounds to be granted asylum in the European Union.
lead_paragraph: The existence of laws imprisoning gays “may constitute an act of persecution per se” if they are routinely enforced, said the ruling by the European Court of Justice.

headline.main: Court Ruling Supports Gay Refugees Seeking Asylum Because of Persecution
headline.print_headline: Court Ruling Supports Gay Refugees Seeking Asylum Because of Persecution
